intro: Zenkerella schliebenii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by distinctive, fleshy berries. Its roots and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported medicinal properties. Botanically, it is notable for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations to its native environment.
